title: Information Security And Data Protection Policy En
text:
None
Information Security and Data Protection Policy Version 2025 – Confidential Internal Document

title: Information Security And Data Protection Policy En
text:
None
Preamble This Information Security and Data Protection Policy defines the comprehensive framework adopted by FinSight Bank to ensure the confidentiality, integrity, availability, and traceability of the information it holds or processes. Its purpose is to protect information systems and personal data from any form of alteration, loss, unauthorized access, or fraudulent use. The policy complies with Tunisian Law No. 2004-63 on personal data protection, the requirements of the National Authority for the Protection of Personal Data (INPDP), as well as the principles of the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and international standards ISO/IEC 27001 and ISO 27701. It constitutes a key pillar of FinSight Bank’s governance system, ensuring customer trust, regulatory compliance, and operational resilience in an ever-evolving digital environment.

title: Information Security And Data Protection Policy En
text:
None
1. Objectives and Scope The purpose of this policy is to protect FinSight Bank’s information assets — whether physical, digital, organizational, or human — from any risk of compromise. It defines the principles, responsibilities, and controls required to ensure rigorous management of data and information systems while respecting the rights of data subjects. Scope of application: • All information held or processed by the Bank, regardless of medium (digital, paper, audio, visual); • All employees, contractors, and partners with access to such information; • All systems, infrastructures, applications, and networks used within FinSight Bank’s activities. No processing of personal or confidential data may be conducted outside the rules established by this policy and its operational annexes.

title: Information Security And Data Protection Policy En

rows.values: Principle:Confidentiality, Definition:Information is accessible only to authorized individuals., Operational Objective:Prevent leaks or unauthorized disclosure.
Principle:Integrity, Definition:Data must be accurate, complete, and protected against unauthorized alteration., Operational Objective:Ensure reliability and validity of information and transactions.
Principle:Availability, Definition:Systems and information must remain accessible to authorized users as needed., Operational Objective:Guarantee business continuity during incidents.
Principle:Traceability, Definition:Every significant action must be logged and verifiable., Operational Objective:Enable audit and event reconstruction.

title: Information Security And Data Protection Policy En

rows.values: Actor:Board of Directors, Role and Responsibilities:Validates the global security policy and ensures strategic oversight.
Actor:Risk and Compliance Committee, Role and Responsibilities:Supervises major incidents and GDPR compliance programs.
Actor:General Management, Role and Responsibilities:Holds ultimate responsibility for security and allocates necessary resources.
Actor:Chief Information Security Officer (CISO), Role and Responsibilities:Defines strategy, leads cybersecurity projects, and manages incidents.
Actor:Data Protection Officer (DPO), Role and Responsibilities:Ensures compliance with GDPR/INPDP, manages data subject rights, and handles regulatory notifications.
Actor:Employees and Users, Role and Responsibilities:Comply with security rules, report incidents, and protect credentials.

title: Information Security And Data Protection Policy En

rows.values: Classification Level:Confidential – Strategic, Type of Information:Critical institutional information, Examples:Risk reports, strategic plans, Associated Security Measures:Strong encryption, restricted access, regular audits

Classification Level:Confidential – Client, Type of Information:Personal or financial identifiable data, Examples:KYC files, account statements, Associated Security Measures:Data masking, secure storage, partial anonymization

Classification Level:Internal – Restricted, Type of Information:Non-public operational data, Examples:Procedures, internal reports, Associated Security Measures:Role-based access control, automatic backup

Classification Level:Public, Type of Information:Information for external release, Examples:Press releases, public reports, Associated Security Measures:Controlled publication by Communications Department

title: Information Security And Data Protection Policy En
text:
None
5. Personal Data Protection FinSight Bank processes personal data lawfully, fairly, and transparently. Each processing activity is declared or notified to the INPDP in accordance with Tunisian law. Data collection is limited to what is strictly necessary, retained for a defined period, and secured according to its sensitivity level. Data subjects have the following rights: • Right of access to personal data; • Right to rectification of inaccurate data; • Right to object to processing under legal conditions; • Right to erasure and data portability, where applicable. Requests are managed by the DPO, who maintains records and ensures compliance with response deadlines.

title: Information Security And Data Protection Policy En

rows.values: Incident Type:External Cyberattack, Examples:Phishing, ransomware, DDoS, Response Procedure:Activate SIRP, isolate network, notify CISO/DPO
Incident Type:Data Breach, Examples:Unauthorized file disclosure, Response Procedure:Impact analysis, report to INPDP within 72h
Incident Type:Critical Outage, Examples:Server unavailability, database corruption, Response Procedure:Activate BCP, restore from backups
Incident Type:Internal Violation, Examples:Misuse of access by employee, Response Procedure:Suspend access, initiate investigation, update permissions.

title: Information Security And Data Protection Policy En
text:
None
7. Awareness and Security Culture Security culture is a key component of FinSight Bank’s resilience. Employees must adopt responsible behavior and complete mandatory cybersecurity and data protection training organized by the IT Security and HR Departments. Training topics include password management, phishing prevention, and digital hygiene. Internal awareness campaigns, vulnerability assessments, and simulated attacks are regularly conducted to reinforce vigilance. Serious or repeated violations of security rules may lead to disciplinary measures under internal regulations.

title: Information Security And Data Protection Policy En
text:
None
8. Audits, Controls, and Continuous Improvement Information security is continuously monitored and audited. The IT Security Department performs quarterly technical reviews, and Internal Audit conducts annual evaluations of overall effectiveness. Audit results are submitted to the Risk Committee and followed by corrective action plans with defined deadlines. FinSight Bank applies the continuous improvement principle (PDCA – Plan, Do, Check, Act) to adapt to evolving threats and regulations. Major system or regulatory changes trigger a review of this policy.

title: Information Security And Data Protection Policy En
text:
None
9. Review and Entry into Force This policy is reviewed annually or following any major incident, regulatory inspection, or technological development. Updates are prepared jointly by the CISO, DPO, and General Management, then validated by the Risk and Compliance Committee. It enters into force on January 1, 2025, and is mandatory for all FinSight Bank staff, subsidiaries, and partners.
